poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Sap recedes. The boughs of the beech Rise out of reach, again. Why hang round To be insulted? Slap of December, Children suddenly too clever, The scarp of beauty - steep. Zap it And the other channel's deid. So Stamp in the cold snap. Clutch at the littlest Scrap of that tingle in the scalp, Fraying strap.
